attributes.action: Breaking the stigma & promotion of low calorie and restrictive diets
attributes.background: It's time there is proper nutrition education in which people understand how to safely fuel their body in a way that's sustainable. Ensure content on social media is limited, that supporting and reflecting healthy eating.Warnings & triggers should be put on content which promotes  unhealthy habits.
attributes.additional_details: In the health and fitness industry it's very prominent that there are common harmful misconceptions. For example calorie deficits that will sustain a toddler, meal replacement shakes, cutting out food groups. Promoting skinny tea, unrealistic and unsustainable diets in which result in dramatic results linking to Binge Eating Disorder, Bulimia, Anorexia. It is time we enforce boundaries for the public's safety and wellness.

rejection.details:
We understand you're concerned about the promotion of certain foods and diets, however it's not clear which specific foods or diets you are concerned about, nor how any 'limit' on social media promotion would work.

You might like to sign this petition which calls for a related action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/556172

attributes.action: Please stop tourists coming to Cornwall during the Coronavirus breakout.
attributes.background: Stop anybody from coming to Cornwall during the Coronavirus outbreak either on holiday or to second homes. We have one hospital for the entire County. We cannot sustain any extra people who may chose to visit during this time. We also need to contain the spread of disease.
attributes.additional_details:
Please shut down any holiday outlets or use of second homes during this difficult time. We understand the effect that this will have on the Tourism industry but we must be responsible & save lives within our County at this difficult & challenging time.
We also cannot sustain the extra influx of people in our supermarkets. We are struggling for food now due to stockpiling.
Cornwall will happily welcome anyone wanting to visit when this crisis is over.

rejection.details:
Since you started your petition, the Government has imposed a number of restrictions on individuals and businesses as a result of the coronavirus outbreak. You can find out what you can and can't do here: https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/coronavirus-outbreak-faqs-what-you-can-and-cant-do/coronavirus-outbreak-faqs-what-you-can-and-cant-do

If you wish the Government to place further restrictions on individuals and businesses, you may wish to sign some of the petitions below.

If you want the Government to close all businesses that 'are not vital', you may wish to sign this petition: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/308122

If you want the Government to implement a complete lockdown, you may wish to sign this petition: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/310805

If you want the Government to close all shops including supermarkets, you may wish to sign this petition: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/310341

attributes.action: Cut the standard VAT rate from 20% to 12.5% to encourage economic growth
attributes.background: To encourage strong economic growth, the rate of Standard VAT needs to be reduced, ideally for a minimum of 5 years.
attributes.additional_details:
This should encourage investment and help sustain economic growth and make Britain more attractive to businesses and investors.
 
Our economy is in peril and we believe one of the fairest ways to help low income households is to reduce the burden of taxation by lowering the standard rate of VAT.
 
Lower VAT rates stimulate growth and investment, but we need to go further than the previous 15% VAT rates of the past and look at bringing in a VAT rate that helps to support our country through global uncertainty.
 
The increase in trade that a reduction could generate should make up for the initial drop in tax revenue collected.

attributes.action: Reconsider the ban on fracking for gas
attributes.background: With the reliance on Russian gas the energy costs to the working man is not sustainable.
attributes.additional_details: Resume the fracking projects

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition which calls for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/608745

attributes.action: Keep all gyms open during lockdown from January 2021 until foreseeable future.
attributes.background: Take a logical approach. Healthy and happy people are less likely to fall ill and put additional pressure on the NHS.
attributes.additional_details: We are in the height of winter and freezing temperatures. It is unreasonable for the government to ask us to exercise in freezing temperatures or in heavy rain where we may get ill. Exercise plays a key role in keeping our bodies and immune systems strong along with a healthy diet. There is no evidence to say gyms are a place where the virus spreads. It is also vital for mental health sufferers who can not see counsellors and therapists on a face to face basis. Humans are social creatures and denying us the right to keep ourselves mentally and physically well is a major factor in depression and suicide spikes and other rising health issues currently. The government is denying us our basic human right to sustain a happy lifestyle.

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/556956

attributes.action: Introduce minimum milk price for farmers to establish better British practices.
attributes.background: The government should introduce a minimum milk price that farmers should receive per litre of milk that increases alongside inflation to enable farmers to afford huge changes needed in environmental and ecological development and to ensure cattle management is set to a high standard.
attributes.additional_details: Consumer price and market has been dictating milk price since the collapse of the milk board and has driven to supermarkets taking larger cuts while farmers prices have remained stagnant. To ensure that the British farming economy develops to sustain British production standards we need to promote good practice and fair pricing. pricing must be focused on the farmers rather than the overall milk price to consumers to ensure a guarantee to farmers which will drive Standards of British farming

rejection.details:
We think this petition is similar:
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/314402

attributes.action: Ban use of shark squalene in any human vaccine production
attributes.background: To legislate to stop pharmaceutical companies from using shark based squalene (liver oil) in vaccine research or to create vaccines and instead only use plant based squalene alternatives which are just as effective.
attributes.additional_details: Many shark species are already critically endangered and in desperate need  of protection not further exploitation. Globally we are already killing 100 million sharks annually, with 75% of these being used to make shark fin soup. This is not sustainable and if it continues many shark species will become extinct in my lifetime. Killing an extra 500,000 sharks to provide squalene for vaccine research is completely unnecessary as sustainable plant based alternatives are available eg from olive oil

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/552673

attributes.action: Raise the wage of all key workers who are earning under £15.
attributes.background:
To increase wages of all key workers earning under £15 a hour.  

This includes: NHS staff, carers, food shop workers, food delivery drivers and all essential key workers.
attributes.additional_details:
The Coronavirus pandemic has shown us all what jobs are truly important to our society.

These same people were declared "unskilled workers" not too long ago, since current events they're now known as key workers, essential to our countries sustainability. 

The majority work 37.5 hours a week (some going into 50 hours) just to bring home a wage to be able to pay bills and buy the necessaties. 

It's time to take the strain off our national heros, now on the frontline.

rejection.details:
The Government is not responsible for setting the salary of most key workers, or setting minimum wages for particular sectors, but you may wish to sign petitions calling for the following actions:

Make hazard pay mandatory for key workers in the midst of COVID 19: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/307619

Give all key workers a 100% tax and Nat. Ins. holiday through COVID-19 crisis: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/306845

Pay bonus to all key workers: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/307215

Incentivise NHS staff during the COVID19 outbreak by making wages untaxable: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/304595

Increase pay for NHS healthcare workers and recognise their work: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/300073

Bonus for emergency services personnel working due to COVID-19: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/303306

Make the minimum wage equal for all ages and increase to at least £10: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/301749

attributes.action: Nationalise the Premier League
attributes.background: Football clubs are community institutions. Generations of fans have contributed time, love & money building and sustaining them. Entities with no connection to these communities now “own” them and wish to sever historic connections to our domestic league. Fans must own and control their own clubs.
attributes.additional_details: Govt can mirror German regulations requiring 51% fan ownership of football clubs. They are a key part of our communities and should not be remotely controlled by groups from outside the local community and supporters groups.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign this petition which calls for the same action:

'Enforce the “50+1” Rule for professional football club ownership in the UK': https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/583310.

You might like to know that on Monday 19 April the Culture Secretary Oliver Dowden MP said that he was appalled by the announcement that a handful of clubs are proposing to form their own breakaway European league, ands said the Government would not hesitate to protect one of our greatest national institutions: football. The Culture Secretary said that the Government would back the football authorities to stop this move, and if the football authorities couldn’t act, the Government would. The Culture Secretary said the Government would "put everything on the table to prevent this from happening."

You can read the Culture Secretary's full statement on the European Super League here: https://www.gov.uk/government/speeches/statement-by-oliver-dowden-on-the-european-super-league

Since you started your petition it has also been announced that all six Premier League teams that were initially involved in the European Super League have withdrawn. You can read a report of this news here: https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/56823501

Further, on 19 April the Government announced a 'Fan-led review of football governance', which will explore ways of improving the governance, ownership and financial sustainability of clubs in English football, building on the strengths of the football pyramid. You can read more about this review here: https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/fan-led-review-of-football-governance

attributes.action: Stop all trawler fishing
attributes.background: Ban all trawler fishing in the U.K. and only allow responsible and sustainable fishing
attributes.additional_details: Trawler fishing is destroying our oceans to the extent that they are going to be wiped out completely and since human life depends on our oceans being healthy it is a matter of urgency that we all be involved in the responsibility of doing what we can.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you are concerned about existing fishing practices, but we're not sure exactly what types of fishing you want to be banned, and what types of fishing you want to continue to be permitted.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Ban Bottom Trawling in UK waters: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/569153

Ban the use of super trawlers in UK waters: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/581898

Ban all fishing in UK waters, except rod and line, for 5 years: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/581588

attributes.action: Allow gyms to give 2 people at the same time a 1h slot to use the gym floor
attributes.background: Allow gyms to give 2 people at the same time a 1h slot per day to use the gym floor. People with injuries depend on gym equipment, so for tier 4 or lockdowns, gyms should give people who need it the most access to their facilities! Furthermore entering a gym is safer than entering another household!
attributes.additional_details:
People with physio injuries can't walk on pavements or do outdoor/home exercises, for certain injuries you need special equipment which only gyms have!
It is neither healthy nor fair towards people to spend all lockdowns/tier 4 on painkillers all the time! Every time you're closing the gyms I've been back on pain killers and sleeping tablets, prescribed by my GP of your NHS and who knows what the long term damage to my knee will be if you keep gyms closed- this is not sustainable at all!

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign this petition calling for gyms to be allowed to open:
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/556956

The decision to prioritise entry for certain customers would be a decision for individual gyms if they were allowed to reopen, not the UK Government or Parliament.

attributes.action: Abandon all planned NHS cuts, closures and downgrades with immediate effect
attributes.background: There are scores of plans to close, downgrade and cut hospital services and hospital bed numbers, across the country, largely as part of Sustainability and Transformation Plans (STP).
attributes.additional_details:
England is now divided into 44 "Footprint" areas and over half of them are planning to make significant cuts to hospital provision.
We have fewer hospital beds per 1000 population than almost every other developed country. Japan has 13 beds per 1000, Germany 8 and UK just 2.5.
Some STP plans would reduce local bed numbers to less than 1.4 beds per 1000 population. 
Now we face the #Covid19 crisis and the results of previous cuts in  our NHS have become even more evident.
For example Germany has 29 acute  hospital beds per 100,000 of the population
In the UK we have just 6.6 acute beds per 100,000. 
We ask that the Government does what ever is necessary to ensure that all existing plans for further NHS cuts, closures and downgrades are abandoned, permanently, with immediate effect .

rejection.details:
Sustainability and Transformation Plans are operational matters for NHS England and NHS Improvement, not the Government or Parliament.

We have published the following, related petitions, which you might like to sign:

Ensure continued Universal health cover by legally committing to a minimum spend: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/300925

Revoke the Health and Social Care Act 2012 and renationalise the NHS: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/300019

attributes.action: Take action against local shops inflating prices on goods because of covid 19
attributes.background: Crack down in shops that are purposely inflating prices due to covid 19 isolation. Raising and purposely inflating prices where people are not being able to work etc can cause hardship. The government has to do something
attributes.additional_details: Naming and shaming won’t help during this crisis, society as a singular must be able to sustain themselves. Shops raising prices by 500/600 percent does not help the poor and the vulnerable nor does it help socially. As a country we should be stood as one to combat this but it seems that people are taking advantage of the poor for financial gain during this crisis. Fines should be introduced as well as a hotline allowing people to report this despicable behaviour.

attributes.action: Increase the provision of free school meals to up to £5 a day at all schools.
attributes.background: Students that rely on their school's canteen to get at least one meal a day should be able to purchase a sufficient amount of food to sustain them for the rest of the day £2.20 a day is not enough.
attributes.additional_details: I am about to enter year 13 and since year 7 I have been provided with £2.20 a day for school meals which was hardly ever enough especially now as a 17 year old. I do not want anymore children having to buy significantly less than their peers and feeling embarrassed about it once they enter secondary school.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you're concerned about arrangements for free school meals, but we're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. Students entitled to free school meals are entitled to free meals, but do not receive an amount of money to spend on food. The Government provides funding to schools for students who are on free school meals, to help cover the cost of providing these.

We could accept a petition calling on the Government to increase what students entitled to free school meals are entitled to be given by their school, or to increase funding for free school meals, to improve the quality and amount of food that is provided, if either of those are things you want to happen.

attributes.action: Make energy use more sustainable by making unsustainable energy more expensive.
attributes.background: If we change the prices on different types of energy, we could help people make a different choice. Make sustainable energy more mass-produced by making it cheaper, and making unsustainable energy more expensive.
attributes.additional_details: I want the Government to do it because energy pollution is a big problem and this could be a good way to solve it. If the Government do it it could be a big advantage to the country.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you're concerned about sustainability of energy, but we're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do.
Decisions about the cost of energy are a matter for generators and Ofgem, not the UK Government or Parliament.

We could accept a petition calling on the Government to increase taxes on generators of non-renewable energy, to make renewable energy comparatively cheaper, if that's something you'd like to happen.

attributes.action: Create a flat tax system and ban tax havens
attributes.background: In order to create a fairer society the UK should adopt a flat tax system over £18000 earned annually and simultaneously abolish all over forms of taxation including business rates, VAT, council tax and corporation tax.
attributes.additional_details: Banning tax havens while making it mandatory that all UK companies have UK registered headquarters for tax purposes will ensure a fair low tax system and simultaneously ensure the UK has enough tax revenue to sustain our society while ensuring long term stable economic growth.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you are concerned about existing tax arrangements, but we're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do.

We understand that you want a flat tax for people earning over £18,000 per annum, but it's not clear how much you want them to be taxed.

"Tax havens" are countries that have low tax regimes, and the Government is not responsible for the tax regimes of other countries. HMRC already pursues individuals and businesses for tax non-compliance involving tax havens: https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/use-of-marketed-tax-avoidance-schemes-in-the-uk/use-of-marketed-tax-avoidance-schemes-in-the-uk

We also couldn't accept a petition that made unsubstantiated assertions about the outcome of the changes you have proposed.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

attributes.action: University international students should get a 50% tuition fee refund.
attributes.background: We demand the government should request university to refund at least 50% of the school fees to international students, which is a compulsory and immediate action.
attributes.additional_details: The government is committed to a sustainable funding model that supports high-quality provision, meets the skills needs of the country and maintains the world-class reputation of UK HE. We can see it is not the case. Notwithstanding universities ensure that courses are high-quality with blended-learning, it is unlawful for students to attend face to face classes during the lockdown. As the UK is the most affected country at this moment, it is impossible to forecast a promising relaxation of lockdown and the quality of teaching significantly deteriorates. Such inflexible tuition fee adjustment weakens international students' confidence in the UK education system due to the indifferent attitude of the UK government, which critically damages the reputation of the UK educational system.

rejection.details:
Individual universities are responsible for deciding whether to refund students, but we have published the following petition, which you might like to sign: 

Tuition Fee Compensation for International Students in UK Universities: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/572202

attributes.action: Create a UK Wellbeing and Future Generations Act
attributes.background: The Government should enact legislation to create new requirements for Public Bodies and Private Companies to consider the following areas when making any decisions: The Environment, Wellbeing, Future Generations, Health, Communities, Sustainable Development.
attributes.additional_details: I am calling for the UK Government to develop new legislation to include a stand-alone set of laws that requires Public Bodies and Private Companies to consider the impact of their operations' footprint on the above areas to ensure a better environment for Future Generations' to come. The legislation should include penalties for failure to consider the areas above when decisions are made.

departments.name: Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy

attributes.action: End lockdown policy. Give people freedom to choose with support for vulnerable.
attributes.background:
Repeal the Coronavirus Act 2020. Stop all local or national lockdowns. Follow WHO advice of not using lockdown as a measure and create a more sustainable way of managing coronavirus. 

Provide a system of assessing people's vulnerability and available support based on health.
attributes.additional_details: The future of many has been taken away by policies that do not work in keeping coronavirus at bay. The UK Government missed the opportunity to prevent the spread of coronavirus in March. Every day which involves arbitrary and half hearted measures does not prevent the spread and harms the economy in the long run. We need to act now to save our future. There is little chance of a miracle to return life to normality so the Government need to take that step and put us on a course to economic recovery. Provide support for those who need help due to their vulnerability.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign some of these petitions:

Repeal the Coronavirus Act 2020: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/313310

Do not implement a second national lockdown or other restrictions this winter: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/549862

Fund & provide services to allow the vulnerable to shield & re-open the economy: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/552023

attributes.action: Stop the UK-USA trade deal.
attributes.background: Stop the importation of food produced to lower US welfare standards. Hormone-fed beef and chlorinated chickens should not be sold in UK grocery markets. These products’ pending accessibility will harm public health and UK farming due to competition of low prices.
attributes.additional_details: Consuming hormone-fed foods increases the risk of health issues, hormonal imbalance and cancer. These items are marketed at a cheap price and this targets lower socioeconomic groups and contributes to the vulnerabilities of health in low-income households. These products threaten business for British small and sustainable farms. This method of farming causes cows, chickens and pigs to grow unnaturally fast to speed production, threatening animal welfare and climate change.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign these petitions calling for the same action:

Disallow Food that is Lower than the Minimum UK Production & Welfare Standards: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/326837

Legislate in the Agriculture Bill to protect the UK’s Food & Farming Sector: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/321419

attributes.action: Abolish the Immigration Health Surcharge for NHS workers
attributes.background: Foreign NHS workers are an asset to their communities, not a burden. While providing invaluable contribution to the NHS it is unacceptable that they must pay £624 annually for themselves and their family to access the very service to which they dedicate their working lives. The IHS must be scrapped.
attributes.additional_details:
The charge for foreign NHS workers is a perverse deterrent to the staff we desperately need to sustain the NHS. Against the backdrop of the Covid 19 pandemic, which has seen disproportionate impact on BAME and foreign born NHS workers this grave injustice has been thrown into stark relief. 

The founding principle of the NHS is provision of universal healthcare free at the point of need.The Immigration Health Surcharge must therefore be scrapped beginning with NHS workers and their dependents.

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/301948

attributes.action: Improve the aid extended to self-employed people unable to work due to Covid-19
attributes.background: Make the aid offered to self-employed people unable to work due to Covid-19 on a par with the aid offered to those on PAYE i.e. remove the following inclusion criteria i) cap of >£50k p/a ii) those who have recently become self-employed.
attributes.additional_details: Self-employed people pay taxes and NI, just as people on PAYE. With the current aid offered, many self-employed people will fall through the gaps, unable to meet living expenses. Just because some self-employed earn over £50k p/a or have only just become self-employed does not mean they have savings or the means to sustain living expenses,

rejection.details:
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/310471

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/310455

attributes.action: Give all GCSE and A-LEVEL students their predicted grades
attributes.background: Help this generation of exam takers, secure their grades, so they are able to sustain on to the future they are aiming for to extend their education.
attributes.additional_details:
Giving predicted grades will allow this generation students to not be stuck behind a year and able to continue with the scheme of education and progress on to further education for example: university or degree apprenticeship. 
Giving predicted grades will enable the younger generation to make an impact if they are able to use their predicted grades and progress into the career they aim to achieve.

attributes.action: Increase all fossil fuel price by 2% every month until 2050.
attributes.background: The UK Government must collect an increasingly higher duty on all types of fossil fuel used for all private and business uses. These extra funds must be aimed at fast-tracking sustainable and affordable green energy and support a generational transition to sustainable business practices.
attributes.additional_details: Climate change requires a drastic change in everyone's lifestyle. Fossil fuel is the main cause of it, and we need to stop using it now. Churchill famously said 'I have nothing to offer but blood, toil, tears and sweat', and without a rapid change of course we will soon face food and water scarcity and a breakdown of society as we know it. Collecting more duty from all fossil fuels will force consumers and businesses to change habits and fund a fundamental shift across the entire nation.

rejection.details:
Petitions must call for a specific action that the UK Government or Parliament are directly responsible for.

The Government is responsible for setting duties on fuel and other fossil fuel products, but decisions about prices for these products are a matter for manufacturers and retailers, not the Government or Parliament.

As a result it is not possible for the Government or Parliament to take the action you have requested.

We could accept a petition calling for changes to duties on fuel and other fossil fuel products, if that's what you want to happen.

attributes.action: Make sustainability a core subject in School syllabus and adult education
attributes.background:
Make sustainability a core or mandatory subject in School syllabus, College and University courses, post graduate courses, driving, health and safety courses, site inductions etc.

Making this vital subject mandatory will educate the nation to focus on a sustainable future for our world.
attributes.additional_details:
We are at a critical point in the world with CO2 levels at a record high, over fishing killing our seas, deforestation occurring at an alarming rate, global warming causing terrifying conditions globally.

Education is vital to ensure people support the positive actions toward a better future within the near future. Without education the nation will not actively support the changes required! This not only needs to target children but also adults, as adults are the primary problem.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. The UK Government aren't responsible for the content of college and university courses, postgraduate courses, driving, health and safety courses, site inductions etc.

You could start a petition calling for sustainability to be added to the National Curriculum, if that's something you'd like to see happen.

attributes.action: Prevent unsustainable fishing and protect our oceans
attributes.background:
The Government should take strong action against unsustainable fishing to protect our dying oceans. 

The Government should hold companies accountable for claiming their fish is sustainably sourced. Other countries should also be held accountable for human rights issues in the fishing industry
attributes.additional_details:
Oceans dying globally is not just a issue for those animals that live it, it is a serious environmental issue that will impact our way of life.

Protecting the oceans is in our best interests, to protect the planet. The first of many steps that needs to be take is Government recognition of the issue as well as actions that will reduce the fishing industry’s impact on the planet.

rejection.details:
We understand you are concerned about the impact of fishing on our oceans, however it's not clear which specific steps you want the Government to take to "hold companies accountable for claiming their fish is sustainably sourced". It's also not clear what steps you want the Government to take to hold other countries accountable for "human rights issues in the fishing industry".

You could start a petition calling on the Government to ban the sale of fish that has not been sustainably sourced, if that is something you'd like to see happen.

attributes.background: Students who are in zero hour contracts or not in employment, should receive financial assistance during this time. As no full time student is eligible to apply for any government funding schemes.
attributes.additional_details: Students also have bills to pay and without government assistance, it would be impossible to sustain themselves.

attributes.action: Fix the price of fuel with a variable tax rate to improve cost of living crisis
attributes.background:
A variable tax model will ensure that the price of fuel doesn't change so that when fuel prices soar like they have, consumers don't feel like they're exploited.

For example, when the price of fuel rises, lower the tax rate. When the price goes down, raise the taxes so that prices are fixed.
attributes.additional_details:
I feel like this is a necessary change as the cost of living is affecting EVERYONE, especially those who are struggling to heat their homes and and find a meal for the day.

Those who commute to their place of work and small business owners are reliant on fuel, and may have no alternative.

With this system, the government can still have sustainable income with tax and fuel duty. This will also help encourage fuel companies to keep their prices down when pricing their petrol and diesel.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you're concerned about the cost of fuel, but it's not clear how what you've suggested would work in practice. For example, it's not clear what you would want to happen if the cost of fuel was higher than the "fixed price" you want to be set. It's also not clear what price you want the Government to seek to maintain.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

attributes.action: Ban fish meals in schools
attributes.background: Due to the impact of fishing, stopping fish meals in schools should help address this issue. It’s unsustainable. Up to 85% of our oxygen comes from the ocean. Government need to act on this important issue.
attributes.additional_details: Government ultimately can decide what’s on the menu for schools in the England. Banning this from the menu will help ensure we are saving our oceans and making the right steps for a more sustainable future.

attributes.action: Introduce a zero waste and sustainable school policy
attributes.background: Allow schools to have the resources to repatriate their waste for creative school learning such as plastic, paper, cardboard and giving schools the ability to grow their own food on-campus.
attributes.additional_details: An initiative that encourages school students to grow their own food on campus will highlight the benefits of a healthy meal and develop an understanding of horticulture through educational learning.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do.  Schools are already able to choose to do this. 
	
You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do, such as creating a new fund for schools to be able to adopt it.  You might also be interested in this petition:

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/562920

attributes.action: Give more financial support to hospitality closed due to COVID-19 restrictions
attributes.background: Currently, the government are providing just £2,000.00 a month in financial aid to businesses closed due to COVID-19 restrictions. This is not nearly enough for those business to pay their bills whilst not receiving any income and if this continues, the entire industry will be decimated.
attributes.additional_details: Although the £2,000.00 a month plus furlough is providing some help to businesses, it is not enough to sustain them for an indefinite period of time without income, especially since they have been through this once already for four months. If the government wants to keep these businesses shut, it needs to provide more support or there will be no pubs and bars left if we ever do become free of restrictions.

attributes.action: Give information on when the beauty sector will be able to re-open.
attributes.background: Give specific information out to the beauty sector on when & how we can prepare to re-open with regards the Coronavirus pandemic.
attributes.additional_details: Beauty salons including nail bars have now been closed for over 3 months. This seems to be the forgotten sector but the beauty industry is worth over £18 Billion. We need to know when we should be expected to re-open so that we can plan, prepare & keep our loyal clients updated. Some business' may not be able to sustain longer closures so this information is imperative to our industry to allow us to make these decisions.

attributes.action: Implement recommendations in the PHE review of impact of Covid-19 on BAME people
attributes.background: The Government should implement recommendations 4 and 7 set out in Public Health England’s review of the impact of Covid-19 on BAME communities, which call for:
attributes.additional_details:
- the accelerated development of culturally competent occupational risk assessment tools to help reduce employees’ risk of catching Covid-19, especially for key workers
- action to ensure that COVID-19 recovery strategies actively reduce inequalities caused by the wider determinants of health to create long term sustainable change. Fully funded, sustained and meaningful approaches to tackling ethnic inequalities must be prioritised.
https://assets.publishing.service.gov.uk/government/uploads/system/uploads/attachment_data/file/892376/COVID_stakeholder_engagement_synthesis_beyond_the_data.pdf

departments.name: Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy

attributes.action: Ensure 'Private Schools' do not charge fees or full fees to parents in COVID-19
attributes.background: Ensure 'Private Schools' do not charge fees to parents where children are not in school; receiving meals; are not able to board & where appropriate remote teaching is insufficient and resource is lacking where the coronavirus situation had not been considered on finance & parents unable to work.
attributes.additional_details:
The vast majority of parents are from working families and not wealthy.  

They cannot afford the ongoing fees for their children that are not reduced; that full fees in most circumstances are still required and being demanded.  

Where there is poor communications with the schools and little webinar support; one to one and group sessions are limited or not implemented as yet and families have no contingency plans and savings to sustain.

Stop fees; have private schools apply to GOV for aid.

rejection.details:
The payment of fees for private schools are a matter for individual schools and fee-payers, not the Government or Parliament.

People who pay fees for private schools will be protected by consumer rights, and details of how to seek advice on consumer protection is available here: https://www.gov.uk/consumer-protection-rights

You can find out more about coronavirus and how you can protect yourself and others here: 

www.gov.uk/coronavirus 

https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/coronavirus-covid-19/ 

The Government has also created an online service to help you out what you can do if you’re struggling because of coronavirus: https://www.gov.uk/find-coronavirus-support 

You can read NHS tips to help if you are worried about coronavirus here: https://www.nhs.uk/oneyou/every-mind-matters/coronavirus-covid-19-anxiety-tips

attributes.action: Introduce food rationing on basic foodstuffs during COVID-19 to frontline staff
attributes.background:
To ensure that all frontline workers can feed themselves and their families to enable nutritional support. 
Bring back the ‘ration card’ or e-rationing, use our technology to create an app, but ensuring that those that are vulnerable or unable can be issued a hard copy version.
attributes.additional_details:
With out a decent nutritional food supply for frontline workers, they will not be able to sustain their own health with the added pressures of working extra hours and extra work demands.
If we don’t sustain and protect frontline workers and those that are vulnerable then there will be no one to look after the sick, or distribute the food to the businesses. We are already as a nation in a state of despair. Please issue ration cards.

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/302823

attributes.action: Resolve the energy crisis through Green energy not by fracking or oil and gas
attributes.background: Resolve the energy crisis by investing in green energy; green energy comes on stream about as quickly as new oil and gas or fracking but doesn't harm the environment. It is also sustainable and lower cost. End the exploration of new oil and gas fields and fracking and back green energy instead.
attributes.additional_details:
Resolving our energy crisis by extracting every last drop of oil, every last whiff of gas, and by fracking will contribute to global warming. Global warming is already causing widespread problems, it would be selfish to contribute further to those.
There is no advantage to turning to oil and gas, for instance offshore wind farms can be built in about the same timescale (and in some cases faster) than new oil and gas. Green energy (on or offshore) will reduce energy prices and help the climate.

rejection.details:
We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Keep The Fracking Ban: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/614611

Address the Energy, Climate and Environment crisis by investing in Renewables: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/617729

Decommission all fossil fuel power stations by 2023: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/620604

Set a target for 70% of UK energy to be renewable by 2030: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/612739

If you'd like the Government to take a specific action different to the above petitions we could accept a new petition about this, but it would need to be clear what specific actions you want the Government to take.

attributes.action: Protect and Enhance Via Francigena and Nature at UNESCO World City Canterbury
attributes.background: Stop Canterbury City Council allowing Corinthian to destroy the holy agricultural land, spring and pilgrimage path  just outside the City to make place for a giant 4,000 house urban extension and sewage works. Uphold international obligation for sustainability: UN resolution 42/187.
attributes.additional_details: People of all faith and none have had spiritual experiences on this land, which has felt the feet of Pilgrims for over 1,000 years and was where Christianity first came back to Britain.  The birdsong, sunset and open space over the fields have sustained residents over lockdown.  Approaching, the Cathedral takes your breath away.  Grade 1 soil produces more crops and it is a final refuge for Kent wildlife whose habitat has been destroyed by urban sprawl without infrastructure. It belongs to all.

rejection.details:
Urban planning and development decisions are the responsibility of each local authority and in this case would be a decision of Canterbury City Council and not one for the UK Government or Parliament.

Most local authorities have their petitioning platform. You can find out more about how to petition Canterbury City Council via the link below:

https://www.canterbury.gov.uk/consultations-and-petitions/petitions/

attributes.action: Reintroduce grants for PV(Solar) installation on domestic properties.
attributes.background: The only way out of the energy crisis is to move away from dependency on fossil fuels and the only way to do this is to focus, develop and implement renewable energy technologies.The installation of renewable technologies is  too expensive to contemplate. Let's help home owners afford them.
attributes.additional_details:
How will it be paid for?
-there are 1.2million people in this country that earn more than £100,000 a year.  temporarily remove the personal tax allowance on all these people. This raises almost £2.5billion a year in tax. 
- The windfall tax on energy companies can be continued while these profits continue. 

The  PV grants  will...
Enable home owners to afford PV.
Reduce demand on our national grid
Reduce damage to the environment
Increase supply and lower gas prices.
Boost sustainable energy

rejection.details:
We have published the following petition, which you might like to sign:

Fund grants for installation of solar panels and battery storage for households: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/613855

Increase subsidies and grants for homeowners to improve their energy ratings: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/619507

attributes.action: Reform the British Empire! Increase military spending! God save the queen!
attributes.background: I want the government to democratically begin reforming the British empire as well as increase military spending and recruiting to aid in the potential future conflicts…
attributes.additional_details: The British army is small in comparison to our allies with only around 80,000 regular soldiers and provisions for 4 months of sustained attrition! The nation is on the brink of war and we are unprepared, our allies have superior armour, troop and aircraft numbers as well as a larger navy! As well as this Britain has gone from being a great Empire to a nation with a gaggle of overseas territories without enough soldiers to effectively defend its waters! Something needs to be done!

rejection.details:
The British Empire no longer exists, but we have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Substantially increase defence spending and the size of the Armed Forces: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/609579

Increase Defence Spending to at least 3% of the United Kingdom’s GDP: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/619184

attributes.action: Restrict any increase in the price of energy bills to 4% per year
attributes.background: The energy price cap is going to be reviewed in March 2022. Due to the price of wholesale gas, bills are expected to soar by between 40- 50%. This comes on top of the projected increase in national insurance, council tax, water and groceries.  Put simply, this is unaffordable
attributes.additional_details: Those whose tariffs have come to an end, or whose energy companies have already collapsed, have already seen increases of up to 100% in the cost of their bills and are making daily decisions as to whether to eat or heat their homes. Those in this position cannot sustain a further increase. Whilst other countries are also affected by the increase in wholesale gas prices, they are dealing with the crisis differently. In France, the government are limiting any increase to the public to 4%, with any losses to funded directly by the industry from their vast profits. Whilst this would still be an increase, it is more affordable than bills rising by a projected 50%. Urgent help is needed now.

rejection.details: We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. The cost of energy is a matter for energy companies, while the energy price cap is a decision for Ofgem.

attributes.action: Protect productive agricultural land and green belt from development in law
attributes.background: Bring in legal protection for  productive agricultural  and green belt land from development.
attributes.additional_details:
We need our prime agricultural land to grow sustainable high quality food which will cut our carbon foot print.  The soil where the crops are growing locks in carbon so is a big part of the fight against the Climate Emergency. The fields also provide habitats and hunting grounds for wildlife.
Green spaces provide a home for biodiversity to thrive also part of the solution to the Climate Crisis. They are also vital for people's health and well being.

rejection.details:
We understand you're concerned about development of greenbelt land, however it's not clear what legal protections you want to be introduced to protect such land. 

If there is a specific legal protection you would like to be brought in, you could start a petition about that.

You may like to sign this petition which calls for a related action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/575169

attributes.action: Teach students to pay taxes and other useful tasks key in adult life.
attributes.background: Change the national curriculum in any way possible to learn useful everyday tasks that every adult must learn to live a sustainable life.
attributes.additional_details:
Teach students around the country to:
- Pay taxes and bills.
- Set up a bank account.
- Access legal and medical documents relevant to the individual.
- Sign legal documents.
- Know what investment scams look like and how to avoid them.
- Learn more about politics.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. The Citizenship curriculum already includes: income and expenditure, credit and debt, insurance, savings and pensions, financial products and services, and how public money is raised and spent

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

attributes.action: Help save our ocean and end government funding towards overfishing.
attributes.background: To help end overfishing, the uk needs to end funding towards the fishing industry. Preserving the ocean by having more guarded and regulated No take zones in the uk oceans. Allowing healthy Marnie life to thrive in our ocean, will have positive effects on endangered species and climate change.
attributes.additional_details:
The uk government has funded over £100 million towards fishing, which is then sold to the consumer as 'sustainable'. The 'sustainable' fishing is killing and endangering not only Marnie life that is intended to be caught but a huge amount of Marnie life is suffering from bycatching. Wild Mammals starving as a result of no fish. 
Marnie life intake our co2 emissions and cool down the climate and produce over 50% of our oxygen. To help support climate change we need to take action on overfishing.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign these petitions which call for the same actions:

'Ban fishing on a third of UK coastal for fish repopulation':
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/553334

'End UK subsidies to the fishing industry': https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/581530

attributes.action: Ban All Single-Use Plastic Bags in the UK
attributes.background: It’s estimated that by the year 2050 there will be more plastic in the oceans than fish. Most single use plastic bags are non-recyclable and will end up in our environment as well as our oceans, polluting and ruining the ocean’s ecosystems. We want the Government to ban all single use plastic bags.
attributes.additional_details:
By banning the single use plastic bag, the UK can send a powerful message that it can be a global environmental leader and inspire other countries to follow our lead. Retailers should offer recycled paper bags for 10p fee or offer reusable bags made out of sustainable materials such as hemp, linen, bamboo, etc. 

Please sign the petition and once you are done share it with everyone you know who cares about the environment and their future on this planet.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign some of these petitions:

Ban plastic bags in supermarkets, and other retail shops: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/328310

Ban plastic bags for online supermarket deliveries: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/549991

attributes.action: Create environmental laws for UK supermarkets
attributes.background: We need supermarkets to act faster on sustainability. Supermarkets need to stop importing goods from countries that are participating in mass destruction of biodiversity and only stock sustainable produce.
attributes.additional_details: Supermarkets have the power to change consumers’ habits and stop offering us produce that are destroying nature. We need to consume less but we need supermarkets to help drive that change and not offer us produce out of season from half way round the world. We also need to reduce waste and start conserving our planet’s resources. But we need to do it now.

rejection.details:
You want supermarkets to "stop importing goods from countries that are participating in mass destruction of biodiversity and only stock sustainable produce" but it is not clear how this would be assessed, or what would be classed as 'sustainable produce'.

You may wish to sign the following petitions which relate to similar issues:
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/549844
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/321482
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/320082

attributes.action: Keep allotments working during the Covid 19 outbreak
attributes.background: If measures to halt the spread of Covid 19 result in people having to stay at home we urge the government to allow allotment holders to work on their allotments.
attributes.additional_details: There are over 300,000 allotment holders in the UK producing thousands of tons of produce each year.  This produce is often shared with family, friends and neighbours which is a valuable sustainable food source.  The majority of allotment holders are pensioners and working on their allotment has enormous physical and mental health benefits.

We must help each other in whatever way we can, and the way to help us all RIGHT NOW is to sign this petition and demand our sustainability

attributes.action: BBC to provide dedicated education channels in the event of school closures
attributes.background: In the event that schools are closed because of the corona virus, that the BBC offer educational programmes on TV to assist parents in continuing their child's education at home.
attributes.additional_details: With possibilities of months of school closure, parents will be generally under prepared in delivering sustained educational stimuli/activities for their children. The net effect on students lives could potentially be very damaging if they were to lose quality educational experiences over weeks if not months

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. This is a matter for the BBC. 

Since you started your petition, the BBC has announced a new range of support during the coronavirus pandemic. You can read about some of it here:

https://www.bbc.co.uk/mediacentre/latestnews/2020/bbc-keeping-nation-informed-educated-entertained

attributes.action: Address&Resolve how cost of living crisis is impacting those on medical diets
attributes.background: As the Cost of Living crisis has progressed, the prices of Gluten Free and Free From foods/drinks have risen to an amount that is no longer sustainable for those on medical diets and is negativity impacting those on low incomes. Something urgently needs to be put in place.
attributes.additional_details: Between 2015-2018 Gluten Free prescriptions for staple foods were withdrawn in a lot of areas within England. As the cost of living crisis has progressed, Free From food prices have also increased to an exorbitant amount. My personal monthly food shop following a strict meal plan to help keep costs down is over £300 for 1 adult & 1 young child. These prices are not sustainable for anyone needing to eat a certain diet for medical reasons, it is certainly not sustainable for those on low incomes.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign this petition which calls for the same action:

Voucher scheme for those with Coeliacs Disease for gluten-free food
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/620602

attributes.action: Stop the unprecedented rise in energy bills.
attributes.background: The significanct rise in energy bills are unjust.  Whilst the population struggle to survive in a 1st world country, energy providers report record breaking profits.  I am calling on the UK Government to urgently reduce the energy price caps to a sensible level, before the winter months arrive.
attributes.additional_details: The UK population simply cannot afford to sustain this way of life, where the decision to eat Vs the decision to heat is a very real threat to life. This affects everyone and is catastrophic to every day life.  It is understandable that prices rise and the war in Ukraine, global warming and various other economic factors all affect this.  However, energy providers are reporting record profits at the expense of the UK population.  Energy is essential for modern day life, please step-up.

rejection.details:
The calculation of the energy price cap is a matter for the regulator Ofgem, which is operationally independent of the UK Government and House of Commons. You can find out more about how the price cap is calculated here: https://www.ofgem.gov.uk/information-consumers/energy-advice-households/check-if-energy-price-cap-affects-you.

We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Temporarily suspend all taxes on all fuels and energy bills: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/610585

Subsidise a 'basic' amount of electricity for households: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/616915

Establish a not-for-profit state owned energy provider: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/617446

Introduce a "Triple lock" to restrict energy cap increases: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/621347
